Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Friday February 13), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script: i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for friday, february 13th. google is rolling out a new artificial intelligence feature for its workspace suite, allowing users to leverage ai-powered tools directly in docs and sheets. the company says this will enhance productivity by automating repetitive tasks and assisting with data organization. google has faced pressure to innovate in the ai space to better compete against microsoft's recent advancements in the sector. meanwhile, meta is making waves in the virtual reality world with its oculus division slated to release a new, more affordable headset later this year. ceo mark zuckerberg highlighted the company's commitment to making vr more accessible, aiming to grow its user base by targeting budget-conscious consumers. over in the semiconductor industry, intel is gaining attention after announcing plans to build a new chip manufacturing plant in ohio. the $20 billion investment is part of intel's effort to bolster domestic chip production amid ongoing global supply chain issues. the move is expected to create thousands of jobs and strengthen the u.s. semiconductor supply chain. that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for friday, february 13th. google is making headlines as it unveils a new artificial intelligence feature integrated into its workspace suite. this enhancement will enable users to tap into ai-powered tools directly within docs and sheets, promising to boost productivity by automating repetitive tasks and facilitating data management. the announcement comes as google faces mounting pressure to innovate in the ai domain to better compete with microsoft's recent advancements in the sector.

turning to the world of virtual reality, meta is making strides with its oculus division. ceo mark zuckerberg has spotlighted the company's ongoing efforts to make vr more accessible to consumers by planning to launch a new, more affordable headset later this year. this move aims to expand meta's vr user base by appealing to budget-conscious individuals.

in the semiconductor industry, intel is capturing attention with its significant announcement of a new chip manufacturing plant set to be built in ohio. the $20 billion investment reflects intel's commitment to enhancing domestic chip production amid persistent global supply chain challenges. this initiative is anticipated to generate thousands of jobs and bolster the u.s. semiconductor infrastructure.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-475 Google's Ai Boost in Workspace 🧑‍💻, Meta's Affordable Vr Headset 🎮, Intel's $20b Chip Plant Initiative 🏭
Podcast Description:
welcome to wall-e's tech briefing for friday, february 13th! explore today's top tech stories:

  • google's ai workspace enhancement: introduction of ai-powered tools for google docs and sheets to improve productivity by automating tasks and simplifying data management amid market pressures.
  • meta's vr expansion: ceo mark zuckerberg announces plans for an affordable oculus headset, aiming to grow meta's vr consumer base and make vr technology more accessible.
  • intel's new chip plant: $20 billion investment in a new ohio-based manufacturing plant to boost u.s. chip production and address global supply chain challenges, promising thousands of new jobs.

stay tuned for more tech updates in tomorrow's briefing!
Image Prompt: a unified podcast cover image depicts a bustling futuristic cityscape at dusk, seamlessly integrating the themes of ai, virtual reality, and advanced manufacturing. in the foreground, sleek office buildings house glowing windows where digital figures interact with holographic ai interfaces, symbolizing google's ai boost in workspace. high above, an affordable yet sophisticated vr headset from meta floats in mid-air, with vibrant digital streams spiraling from its lenses, merging into the surrounding city lights. to the side, towering over the city, is a state-of-the-art chip plant resembling a digital fortress, representing intel's $20 billion initiative, complete with robotic arms and shimmering microchip patterns embedded in its structure. the overall scene captures the essence of technological advancement and collaboration, highlighting the intersection of ai, virtual reality, and semiconductor innovation
